name: Percentage
description: Learn about percentages, their calculation, and applications in various scenarios.
notes: Percentage is a way of expressing a number as a fraction of 100.
Formula: (Value/Total) x 100
To find percentage increase: ((New Value - Old Value) / Old Value) x 100
To find percentage decrease: ((Old Value - New Value) / Old Value) x 100
Simple percentage problems can be solved using cross-multiplication.

name: Profit & Loss
description: Understand profit, loss, and related calculations in business scenarios.
notes: Profit = Selling Price - Cost Price
Loss = Cost Price - Selling Price
Profit Percentage = (Profit / Cost Price) x 100
Loss Percentage = (Loss / Cost Price) x 100
Marked Price is the price marked on the item
Discount = Marked Price - Selling Price
Discount Percentage = (Discount / Marked Price) x 100

name: Time & Work
description: Master time and work problems involving efficiency and productivity.
notes: Work = Time x Efficiency
If A can do work in 'a' days, then A's 1 day work = 1/a
If A and B work together, their combined work = (1/a + 1/b)
Time taken by A and B together = 1/(1/a + 1/b)
If A is 'n' times more efficient than B, then A takes 1/n times less time
Work done = (Number of workers) x (Time) x (Efficiency)

name: Speed & Distance
description: Solve problems involving speed, distance, and time relationships.
notes: Speed = Distance / Time
Distance = Speed x Time
Time = Distance / Speed
Average Speed = Total Distance / Total Time
When two objects move in opposite directions, relative speed = sum of speeds
When two objects move in same direction, relative speed = difference of speeds
For upstream/downstream problems: Speed in still water = (Downstream + Upstream) / 2

name: Ratio
description: Learn about ratios, proportions, and their applications in various problems.
notes: Ratio is a comparison of two quantities in the same unit
Ratio a:b means a parts to b parts
If a:b = c:d, then ad = bc (cross-multiplication)
If a:b = c:d, then (a+b):(a-b) = (c+d):(c-d)
Compound ratio: (a:b) x (c:d) = (ac:bd)
If A:B:C = a:b:c, then A = ka, B = kb, C = kc where k is a constant
For mixture problems: (Quantity1 x Price1) + (Quantity2 x Price2) = (Total Quantity x Average Price)

name: Number Series
description: Identify patterns and find missing numbers in mathematical sequences.
notes: Arithmetic Progression: Each term differs by a constant value
Geometric Progression: Each term is multiplied by a constant ratio
Fibonacci Series: Each term is sum of previous two terms
Square Series: 1, 4, 9, 16, 25... (n²)
Prime Number Series: 2, 3, 5, 7, 11, 13...
Look for patterns: addition, subtraction, multiplication, division, or combination

name: Ages
description: Solve age-related problems using mathematical relationships and ratios.
notes: Age difference between two people remains constant over time
If A's age is x years and B's age is y years, then age difference = |x-y|
After n years: A's age = x+n, B's age = y+n
n years ago: A's age = x-n, B's age = y-n
If A:B = a:b, then A's age = ka, B's age = kb where k is a constant
For age ratio problems, use cross-multiplication: a/b = c/d implies ad = bc
Present age + years passed = future age

name: Simple Interest
description: Calculate simple interest and understand basic financial calculations.
notes: Simple Interest = (Principal x Rate x Time) / 100
Amount = Principal + Simple Interest
Principal = (Simple Interest x 100) / (Rate x Time)
Rate = (Simple Interest x 100) / (Principal x Time)
Time = (Simple Interest x 100) / (Principal x Rate)
When time is in months, divide by 12 to convert to years
When time is in days, divide by 365 to convert to years

name: Probability
description: Learn probability concepts and solve probability-based problems.
notes: Probability = Number of favorable outcomes / Total number of outcomes
Probability ranges from 0 to 1 (0 = impossible, 1 = certain)
P(A or B) = P(A) + P(B) - P(A and B)
P(A and B) = P(A) x P(B) if events are independent
P(not A) = 1 - P(A)
For dice problems: Total outcomes = 6^n where n is number of dice
For coin problems: Total outcomes = 2^n where n is number of coins

name: Average
description: Calculate averages, means, and understand central tendency concepts.
notes: Average = Sum of all values / Number of values
Sum of values = Average x Number of values
If average of n numbers is A, then sum = nA
If a new number is added: New average = (Old sum + New number) / (n+1)
If a number is removed: New average = (Old sum - Removed number) / (n-1)
Weighted average = Σ(Value × Weight) / Σ(Weights)
For consecutive numbers: Average = (First + Last) / 2
